Topic.Title: I used to debate XC, disagreed and criticized him !

Message.Msg: Don't mistake a basher for someone who is right. XC knocks the stock whatever happens. Even serially replies to his/her own posts. Bashers can happen to be right, but it doesn't mean they actually had any analysis that created their conclusions. Same applies to fanboys, for that matter. Over the last year, for example, NVDA has outperformed INTC, AMD, and QCOM (seriously, check it yourself it you don't believe me). Only TXN has beaten them on TTM performance. Now, I don't hear XC telling everyone to get out of the sector, in fact, XC has been pumping AMD from time to time, which has been a great way to lose money. If NVDA has been bash-worthy, I would suggest that being in the sector at all is probably something that you should avoid. Then again, that is another sign of a basher. Those who really understood to stay out of the sector aren't spending their time reading about it daily, are they?

Topic.Title: I used to debate XC, disagreed and criticized him !

Message.Msg: Nvidia didn't sell Intel anything, they licensed it to them for 6 years for 1.5 billion with 4 years left. I don't see anything cutting edge from Intel from said licensing deal. The 1.5 billion has, and will pay for much R&D. Nvidia also received some very needed non-x86 IP from Intel. How long can Apple keep up? Having the top performing chip available along with all the features and IP it has to offer bodes very well for Apple being a customer. If they want to compete and have an edge on Samsung, Apple will have little choice but to do so. High performance gaming is also one area of growth where Apple wants to exploit. The factor that will seal the deal is that it would be cheaper for Apple to co-develop a custom Tegra version with Nvidia.

Message.Title: Toms Hardware comments on HP's 10" Tegra 4 based tablet
Message.Msg: The next tablet HP will reportedly release after its just-launched 7-inch Slate7 will be the SlateBook 10 x2, a 10-inch model based on Android 4.2.2 "Jelly Bean" and Nvidia's new quad-core Tegra 4 SoC. The unannounced tablet appeared on an AnTuTu benchmark clocked at 1810 MHz, or 1.81 GHz. The tablet's SlateBook name implies that the device could be one of the rumored Android-powered notebooks set to be released later this year. However the "x2" label points to a similar Windows 8-based Intel Atom-powered HP Envy x2 tablet, shown on the right, which has a premium metal frame and a detachable keyboard that transforms the device into a clamshell notebook. In fact, the new HP tablet could be quite similar to the Envy x2 outside the OS, SoC and screen size aspects. The Envy x2 weighs only 3.11 pounds without the keyboard, and measures between 0.66 and 0.76-inches. Other features include Beats Audio with dual speakers, a front-facing HP TrueVision 1080p HD webcam, an 8MP rear-facing camera, 2 GB of RAM or more, Bluetooth, NFC and Wireless N connectivity, and up to 64 GB of SSD-based internal storage. ............ In addition to the Slate7 and the Envy x2, HP also offers the ElitePad 900 G1 which features Windows 8 Pro, Intel's Atom Z2760 SoC, 2 GB of RAM and 64 GB of internal storage. The 10.1-inch screen features a 16:10 aspect ratio, multitouch and digitizer capabilities, an anti-smudge coating and Gorilla Glass 2 protection. That said, this unannounced SlateBook 10 x2 will be the company's fourth device in a post webOS-powered TouchPad world. The starting price could be less than the Envy x2 tablet given that HP won't be required to pay licensing fees for Android, and the company will likely make it just as customizable.

Topic.Title: Toms Hardware comments on HP's 10" Tegra 4 based tablet

Message.Msg: Chitown, can't say much without knowing the specs of HP Slate 21 all-in-one, but obviously there is a market for it - and a less crowded one at that. Toshiba had a couple of really big tablets launched last year. I haven't heard that they were blockbusters, but there were flops either. The way to profitability is through product differentiation. We should hear more about these tablets in the near future. One thing I have to say is that when reputable websites like Toms Hardware and Android and me start to write about a certain rumored product, it lends a degree of legitimacy to it - still rumors, true, but now closer to reality.

Message.Title: Tegra division chief Phil Carmack is leaving to become the CEO of an unnamed partner company.
Message.Msg: From seeking Alpha... "Tegra division chief Phil Carmack is leaving to become the CEO of an unnamed partner company. Replacing him is Deepu Talla, who until recently was head of Texas Instruments' OMAP app processor unit."

Message.Title: Tegra poised for growth - organization changes announced today
Message.Msg: Source: NVIDIA website ""As our Tegra mobile processor becomes increasingly important across our businesses, were taking steps to ensure that its supported by the most efficient organizational structure. We announced today that Deepu Talla will head the Tegra business unit. He succeeds Phil Camack, who after 10 years building Tegra from scratch to a three-quarters of a billion dollar business, is leaving NVIDIA to become CEO of one of our partner companies. {Picture of Deepu- nice looking guy!} Prior to joining NVIDIA earlier this year as VP of Tegra business development, Deepu spent more than 10 years at Texas Instruments, most recently as GM of its OMAP mobile computing business. At the same time, we announced that were combining Tegras design team into our larger, engineering structure, which will be now fully centralized across the company. This new org structure reflects the central importance of Tegra not only in our mobile strategy, but increasingly in PCs, gaming, auto and beyond. ______ Ok, this announcement confirms that the Tegra team is formally merged into the GPU group. I posted this information (written by a reputable tech journalist) several months ago, but Getanid didn't believe in it. Now where is Getanid anyone knows? Did he have his shares called?

Tesla and DDD, a next gen car company and a 3D printing company, comparing to Nvidia, a semiconductor company? Or maybe even a benchmark, like the S&P, which Nvidia has delivered 5 times the performance of over the past 5 days. Message.Title: It really wasn't THAT long ago..
Message.Msg: 4-5 weeks ago, I think, I tried to make a "case" that things were changing in the way NVDA stock traded. I suggested to everyone that anyone short any calls at 13, 14, or 15, from May onward, should seriously consider covering any covered calls (or completely uncovered calls). I also mentioned that not only do I have position in the stock that is well over 5 figures in shares. On top of that I mentioned that I "couldn't RESIST" to add to that position a couple of times, but most insistently when the stock dropped on consecutive days to exaaaaaactly 12.04...which was eggzzzzaaaaaaaaaaactly 2 times the cash on hand vis-a-vis the market cap. I tried to make the case to Mslans, to Ashraf (who truly failed as a mature human being, or else a "class guy" by refusing to admit he had lost a bet that he made with me..."ARMH will NEVER, EVER see 45 again". Well, since I've been involved in the markets since WAAAAAAY before he as born, and as a professional trader, I simply had to try to help him realize that you NEVER SAY "NEVER" in the market!!! While the "bet" was only for a nickel, CASH, it was QUITE clear that it was NO IOUs, NO checks, but an honorable bet for the cash money. Not only hasn't he admitted that NEVER came PRETTY quickly..(was less than a WEEK), but I gave him 2 days to come forward, and he has refused. So, although he seems to be pretty bright, he missed his chance to learn directly from me, and showed a lack of maturity or class...and he's now on my ignore list. When I added to my position when I realized what Jen had really been saying at the Analyst Day, I put most of my ready cash into a calendar/laddered position of calls at the 13 and 14 strikes in May, June, September and a few January 2014 15 calls. The position has virtually doubled in value in the last week and a half, and I think there's a LOT more fun in store. This slow steady grind higher, even on the light volume for a couple of days, has shown NO signs of abating. A bit more in post 2 M

Topic.Title: It really wasn't THAT long ago..

Message.Msg: Part 2- While NVDA has moved in a pretty straight line up 10% from where it had languished for months, it's up much more from those 2 days when it traded at 12.04. I suggested to John7777 that he buy back his covered calls since the risk/reward was so bad...giving up all his stock JUST as it broke out to the upside for 13.25-30, was not the wisest choice. Well...oh, never mind. I do think we're near another inflection point...a break higher would likely bring the 52 week high at 15.22 into play...that's essentially a 10% move from here. And, I firmly believe we are going to see at LEAST ONE 10%+ move in the near future, and I honestly doubt it will be down. Since NONE of us "know" why the "tenor" of the action here has changed, we can only make guesses. Whatever YOUR guess....the BIG question is whether this is an elaborate "head fake" (QUITE doubtful but ANYTHING'S possible) or there is SOME news coming that is very important. The OTHER consideration is whether this will become a "buy the rumor, sell the news" trade...MORE possible, but, again, other than a possible Knee-JERK reaction to said news...A PS announced release date and price, OR Earnings, a week form Thursday...I still think that the "resolution" of this trade will be a new 52 week high and then some. IF that level is breached, then I think we'll see 17 1/2-20 in short order. Given the minimal price difference between the May and June 13 calls, I'll look for a spike to sell my May 13s (only 50) and hope for a 10-20 cent pullback and replace them with more of the June 13s, where I already have 125, most of which were bought below 40cents. But the PRICE difference between the two is only 9-12 CENTS, and MOST people don't realize that June is an EXTRA LONG OpEx...as long as they get, a full 5 weeks and the latest day possible, June 21st. I will also add some 13 or 13 1/2 puts just for SOME protection, but this position is too large to hedge. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Best, Max

Topic.Title: It really wasn't THAT long ago..

Message.Msg: Ibexx, Thanks. Finally got the set up I'd been waiting for. I was out of space on the last post, or I was GOING to say the SAME things about QCOM...the timing is TOO "coincidental" to be an accident. Just overlay the two charts for the last 5-10 trading days...NVDA has broken out to the UPSIDE, and QCOM has fallen off a cliff into a Bear Market...broke the 200DMA last week, and failed to reclaim it. Truly a "tell" and quite extraordinary. I think their mention on the CC of "competition" was a reference to perhaps both NVDA and BRCM (which has also rebounded well), although I have no real feel for BRCM. More interesting, so far, is that even with the 10% recovery in AAPL( which might be near its top), it's quite intriguing that QCOM had NO bounce, and had another failed rally attempt today. The next week, with earnings, and, of course, the overall market trying to break through 1600, and the Jobs Report, Friday, are all potential catalysts in one direction or the other. Regardless, I think NVDA'S Long Bear Market has clearly ended, and it may be one of the true leaders in the next leg of this Secular Bull Market rally. While a HUGE fight is likely at 1600, too many PMs and HFs are WAY behind the S&P, year to date, and they will force the market to 1700 or higher, once we break through 1600 and don't give it back. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Best, Max P.S. I just returned from my mother's, today...ugh...close to the end. I'll be back Mother's Day weekend, and don't know how long I'll stay, but was hoping you might be interested in meeting for a drink or dinner...I'd be happy to drive into The City...she lives in Briarcliff Manor, and it takes me 40 minutes or so. Would love to meet in person. M
